title: Introducing: Natasha Haws
body:
Photo: [Caroline Briggs](http://carolinebriggs.co.uk/)

In an age where we’re seemingly overrun with self-indulgent, faux-emotional female singer-songwriters (**Adele**, **Ellie Goulding**, etc.), it’s all too easy for the real talents to be drowned out under a sea of industry processed, irksome crap. This is probably partially the reason that it took me so long to happen across the scintillatingly beautiful music of North East songstress **Natasha Haws**. Alright… maybe songstress is slightly a too strong word to use, give her tender years and relative youthful inexperience, however I have no doubt that with the right guidance and perseverance, she’ll blossom into a performer truly worthy of such an illustrious title.

Having heard much about **Natasha’s** music, I went against all the rules of music blogging, and actually listened to the hype, and boy was it worth it. Her most recent track, the fragile _Stepping Stone_ displays an almost unfathomable level of maturity, as she twists her words with a heartbreaking elegance. The vocals are distinct and verging upon haunting, not so much striking a nerve as mercilessly ripping it from your undeserving body, whilst remaining utterly admirable throughout. In the infamous words of Clive Tyldesley; ‘remember the name: **Natasha Haws**‘.

Check out _Stepping Stone_ below, and grab a free download while you can.
